Utterance: Hi, Ellie!
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been good! I shared my artwork with some friends, and they loved it!
That’s fantastic! How did that feel for you?
It felt amazing! I was really nervous at first, but it went well.
That’s wonderful to hear! What do you think helped you overcome your nerves?
I just kept reminding myself that I created it for me first.
That’s a powerful mindset! Have you created anything new since then?
Yes, I painted a piece inspired by my last trip to the beach.
That sounds beautiful! What colors did you use?
Lots of blues and yellows. It reminds me of the sun and the ocean.
I can picture that! How does it feel to express those memories through art?
It’s really fulfilling. It makes me feel connected to those experiences.
That’s wonderful. Have you thought about any future art projects?
I want to try a larger canvas next.
That’s a great goal! What will you paint?
I’m not sure yet. Maybe something abstract again.
That sounds exciting! We can brainstorm ideas together if you’d like.
Yeah, I’d like that.
Let’s also check in on your mindfulness practice. How’s that going?
I’ve been consistent, and I feel more calm throughout my day.
That’s excellent! Have you noticed any specific situations where it helped?
Yeah, during stressful moments at work. I take a few deep breaths.
That’s a great strategy! It’s wonderful to see you applying what we’ve discussed.
Thanks!
How about your relationship with your brother? Any updates?
We’ve been talking more regularly, and it feels good.
That’s fantastic! Communication can really strengthen relationships.
Yeah, it’s nice to feel more connected.
Have you had any discussions about your family dynamics?
A little. We talked about how we both feel misunderstood sometimes.
That’s important to acknowledge. It can help you both feel validated in your feelings.
Definitely.
Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been thinking about my spending habits again.
Let’s dive into that. What specifically has been on your mind?
I feel like I’m doing better, but I still have moments of guilt when I buy things.
It’s okay to treat yourself, especially if it brings you joy. Have you talked to your wife about it?
Not yet. I think I should.
Communication is key in relationships. It might help to set a budget together that allows for some personal spending.
That sounds good.
Would you like to set that as a goal for our next session?
Yes, I want to talk to her about it.
That’s a great step. I’m proud of you for wanting to address it.
Thanks!
Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to focus on next time?
Maybe we can explore some more mindfulness techniques.
Absolutely! We can try some new exercises together.
I’d like that.
Great! I’m looking forward to our next session. You’re making wonderful progress.
Thanks, Ellie! See you next time!
Take care!
